meanings.definition: Break into small parts or particles
meanings.sent1: The old book started to disintegrate into tiny pieces.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the sandcastle will disintegrate as the waves wash over it.
meanings.sent3: The cookie was so dry that it seemed to disintegrate as soon as I touched it.
meanings.sent4: The team's defense began to disintegrate under the opponent's relentless attacks.
meanings.sent5: The ancient parchment was so fragile that it threatened to disintegrate at the slightest touch.

meanings.sent1: If you leave fruit out for too long, it will start to disintegrate and attract bugs.
meanings.sent2: The old building began to disintegrate, showing signs of neglect and age.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream cone started to disintegrate, leaving a sticky mess on my hands.
meanings.sent4: The once strong friendship began to disintegrate as misunderstandings piled up.
meanings.sent5: The neglected garden shed began to disintegrate, its wood slowly rotting away.

meanings.sent1: The puzzle pieces seemed to disintegrate in my hands as I tried to put them together.
meanings.sent2: As the storm hit, the tent poles started to disintegrate, causing the tent to collapse.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick made the bouquet of flowers disintegrate into a cloud of confetti.
meanings.sent4: The fragile sandcastle disintegrated as soon as a wave touched it, leaving only a mound of wet sand.
meanings.sent5: The fragile relationship between the two countries began to disintegrate under the pressure of conflicting interests.
